item.title: About Live Chat Assignment Methods
item.description:
Overview of Live Chat Assignment Methods link

Chat routing (assignment methods) can be selected from four different methods for agents (support representatives).

Configuration is done from the agent screen left menu: Settings > Chat > Chat Settings.

Details of Chat Assignment Methods link

Random Assignment link

New live chats are assigned randomly and evenly distributed to agents who are available for chat support.

Priority Assignment link

New live chats are assigned to agents according to their assignment priority order until that agent’s chat capacity (slots) reaches the maximum number. For example, if an agent with a slot setting of “3” is handling 3 chats simultaneously, the next incoming new chat will be assigned to the agent with the next highest priority.

item.title: AI Chatbot Plan
item.description:
Complete Overview of the AI Chatbot Plan link

Achieving Ultimate Customer Support 24/7/365 link

SmartWeb’s AI Chatbot Plan is an innovative solution that leverages the latest AI platform “FlowHunt” and LiveAgent’s chat system to automatically answer frequently asked questions even outside business hours and holidays. Complex questions that AI cannot handle are smoothly transferred to human staff through the “escalation function,” allowing small and medium-sized businesses to build comprehensive customer support systems comparable to large enterprises at low cost without inconveniencing customers.

item.title: Benefits of Live Chat Implementation
item.description:
Benefits of Live Chat Implementation: Revolutionizing Customer Support link

What is Live Chat link

Live chat is an innovative support method that enables real-time communication with website visitors. With LiveAgent, support can be provided immediately through chat buttons placed on pages, without requiring any downloads.

Key Implementation Benefits link

This allows you to instantly respond to customers’ “need to know now” requests, significantly reducing response time compared to email or phone. Furthermore, it provides tools for efficient and flexible customer service, including omnichannel integration, proactive invitation features, and visitor behavior tracking.

item.title: Can SSL communication be used for chat and contact forms
item.description:
SSL Communication and LiveAgent Widgets link

The Need for SSL Communication link

Input data sent from LiveAgent’s standard widgets (live chat and contact form buttons, windows, etc.) transmits and receives data without encryption when communicating via HTTP protocol (website URLs starting with “http://”).

To encrypt communication data, you need to implement either “make the widget script SSL-compatible” or “make the webpage where the widget is installed SSL-compatible”.

Methods for SSL Implementation link

Changing Widget Scripts to SSL link

item.title: Chat Button

What is a Chat Button link

An entry point to chat functionality that can be placed on websites. Position it prominently at page edges or as floating display to guide users to real-time support or offline messaging when clicked. Customize colors, shapes, text, and positioning to match your brand while providing intuitive “contact us” pathways for first-time visitors.

Benefits and Effects link

After implementation, you can consolidate initial inquiries through chat, reducing back-and-forth communication compared to email or phone, leading to shorter resolution times. Optimizing design and messaging through A/B testing can also improve chat initiation rates.

Design Considerations for Animations link

Overly flashy effects can become a reason for visitors to leave, so it’s effective to start testing with subtle movements that match the brand’s tone. Set trigger conditions based on page dwell time or scroll amount to guide users at the appropriate timing.

item.title: Chat Distribution

Chat distribution is a system that automatically assigns incoming chats to appropriate agents. It distributes chats based on conditions such as queues, skills, workload, and history to minimize response delays and quality variations.

Even during busy support periods, assignments are made based on rules to prevent bias and missed opportunities. Handoffs from first-line support to specialized departments become smoother, reducing lead time to resolution.

item.title: How to Configure Chat Button
item.description:
What is a Chat Button link

Chat buttons enable real-time conversations between visitors on your website and agents. Chats are also converted to tickets just like other communications and are promptly connected to agents on the configured team.

*Live chat functionality is available on “Professional” or “Advanced” plans.

Additionally, chat buttons allow free configuration of the following:

  • Button design and text
  • Chat window design
  • Presence/absence of offline button, etc.

Beyond the above, it’s also possible to use and configure pre-chat forms where visitors can input their information and question details before starting a chat.

item.title: LiveAgent Live Chat

LiveAgent Live Chat: Efficient Customer Support link

Benefits and Features of Live Chat link

LiveAgent’s live chat feature not only waits for customer inquiries but also allows agents to send requests to customers. Live chat is an excellent support channel that enables customers to make inquiries faster than email and more casually than phone calls, facilitating smooth problem resolution.

Efficient Chat Response link

One of the key features of live chat is that a single agent can handle up to 10 chats simultaneously. Even with a small support staff, you can serve many customers without making them wait in long queues. Utilize “frequently used phrases” to reduce keystrokes and provide smooth and efficient support responses to customers.

item.title: Sending Chat Logs to Customer Email Addresses
item.description:
How to Send Chat Logs link

Chat Log Sending Overview link

Customers can obtain the complete transcript history of their live chat with agents. To retrieve chat logs, customers need to perform one of the following operations.

Sending Method During Active Chat link

During an active live chat, check the “Send chat log to myself” option at the top of the chat window. Then, in the popup window that appears, enter the recipient’s name and email address, and click “OK” to complete the setup. After the chat ends, LiveAgent will automatically send the log.

item.title: Unable to Click URLs Directly in Chat Messages
item.description:
URL Clicking Issues link

When clicking URLs within chat messages, they often don’t function as expected. This is a common challenge caused by limitations in how many chat platforms recognize URLs.

URL Recognition Limitations link

When characters or symbols follow before or after a URL, the system cannot automatically recognize it as a link. For example, in messages like “Details are available at https://example.com/page," the URL may not become clickable. This limitation requires users to manually copy and paste the URL.

item.title: What are the features of live chat functionality?

Live chat is a software technology that enables customers to communicate with customer support representatives in real-time. Instead of making phone calls or sending emails, customers can start chatting on the website, making the interaction process more time-efficient.

Technical Features of Live Chat link

Live chat plugins are completely browser-based, requiring no software downloads for users to start chatting. In today’s world, implementing live chat plugins is essential for a successful customer service strategy.

item.title: What is 'Invitation Chat'

What is Invitation Chat link

Invitation chat is a feature that displays a screen on the web to encourage chat conversations with site visitors who meet certain conditions, such as staying on a web page for a certain amount of time. The invitation screen can be customized using templates and original images.

*The chat feature is available in two plans: 「Professional」and「Advanced」.

item.title: What is the difference between 'Chat Incoming' and 'Chat' information types in reports?
item.description:
About Chat-Related Information Types link

Definition of Chat Incoming and Chat link

Performance reports, team reports, channel reports, and tag reports can aggregate items (information types) including “Chat Incoming” and “Chat”.

Details of Chat Incoming link

“Chat Incoming” refers to the number of chats initiated when website visitors click the chat button. This also counts calls that were disconnected because agents could not respond.

Details of Chat link

“Chat” refers to the total number of all chats that were started.

item.title: What is the maximum number of people that can be handled simultaneously in live chat?
item.description:
LiveAgent Live Chat Simultaneous Response Handling link

Basic Settings for Simultaneous Response link

In LiveAgent’s live chat, the number of people that can be handled simultaneously can be set for each operator. There is a system that allows you to adjust the “maximum number of simultaneous responses” according to experience and skills, enabling efficient responses within a reasonable range.

Typical Number of Simultaneous Responses link

Generally, handling about 3-5 cases per person simultaneously is common, but it’s also possible to increase or decrease this number as needed.
